title: Three plead guilty to racial abuse of 'Super Juan' on a Manchester Metrolink tram - Manchester Evening News
text:
News Three plead guilty to racial abuse of 'Super Juan' on a Manchester Metrolink tram Hundreds of people expressed supported for US Army veteran Mr Jasso after video footage emerged of him being racially abused in Manchester Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch Next 
Three people have admitted racially abusing ‘Super Juan’ on a Metrolink tram. 
Aaron Cauchi, 19, Robert Molloy, 20 and a 16 year old who cannot be named for legal reasons admitted the offence at Manchester Magistrates Court this morning. 
US Army veteran Juan Jasso, from Todmorden, was racially abused on a tram in Manchester city centre in June last year. 
The incident, which was filmed on a mobile phone, led Mr Jasso to become an internet star and be nicknamed Super Juan, after he hit back and told the three to mind their language. 
Hundreds of people took to social media to express their support for him. 
A trial was due to be heard today but all three changed their pleas. Cauchi, of Spa Crescent, Little Hulton, admitted two counts of using threatening words and behaviour and one count of assault. 
Molloy, of no fixed abode, admitted two counts of assault by beating, one of using threatening words and behaviour and another of racially aggravated assault. 
They will be sentenced in court at 2pm. 
The 16 year old from Pendleton admitted two counts of using threatening words and behaviour and one of assault and is expected to be sentenced in youth court at a later date. 
We'll be reporting live from their sentencing and bringing you the latest news here... Share
